newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAA sets 8th weekly Frankfurt-Joburg flight.
newsitem.headline: SAA sets 8th weekly Frankfurt-Joburg flight.

text.p: South African Airways said it planned to add an eighth weekly Frankfurt to Johannesburg passenger flight by this autumn.
An SAA spokeswoman told Reuters: "We have an extra Friday flight but we are still trying to get a slot at the right time."
It was unclear whether SAA would now be able to launch the service this summer or have to wait until the autumn, company sources said.
SAA currently flies daily from Frankfurt to Johannesburg with a combination of Boeing 747-200 and B747-300 aircraft.
Under the summer timetable effective from March 30, five of the seven Frankfurt flights will be continued to Amsterdam and the other two onwards to Copenhagen.
The spokeswoman confirmed a March 2 announcement that the twice-weekly flights from Duesseldorf and Munich would be dropped from the beginning of July due to poor passenger sales.

"There is a concentration on Frankfurt. It is to support the alliance with Deutsche Lufthansa AG and from Frankfurt we have worldwide connections," she explained. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom. Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax: 5017
